Reem Acra is a renowned international designer known for her breathtaking collections in Ready-to-Wear and Bridal. We are seeking an Associate Designer with at least 3 years in Women's RTW and luxury design experience.

Company: Reem Acra

What you must have:
● 3+ years in Women’s RTW and luxury design experience, especially in eveningwear.
● Experience in Technical Design is a must.
● Strong eye for design and ability to communicate concepts and ideas through clear and understandable illustrations, draping, etc.
● Creative eye and a passion for all things artistic and creative; with the high ability to cull research that is season and brand appropriate.
● Strong knowledge of fabrics and materials, garment construction especially in eveningwear, silhouettes and trims.
● Ability to be proactive in research compilation, with a high level of standards for information pulled and disciplined, to edit down to what is most essential/appropriate for the season's direction.
● Capacity to adapt and adjust to ever-changing demands of the fashion landscape.
● High level of computer software proficiency especially Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint.
● Strong communication skills, especially when relaying ideas with pattern makers and sample hands in atelier.
● Strong ability to communicate with overseas partners and vendors, with strong follow up skills.
● Effective management skills, ability to delegate workload and maintain timelines.
● High ability to prepare and present presentations in an organized fashion, illustrating points clearly (visually).
● Strong organizational skills, with ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle tight deadlines, and prioritize workload as needed.
● Ability to collaborate effectively and work well with others.

What you will be doing:
● Work directly with Design Director in supporting the development of seasonal products with a focus on style, aesthetic, fit and fabric that elevates and emphasizes the brand initiative.
● Partner with production and Fabric R&D to design merchandise that fits within the costing parameters and target customer.
● Build and maintain seasonal concept, color and mood boards that adheres to Design Director’s inspiration.
● Prepare creative concepts based on the season’s inspirations.
● Illustrate and render well-thought out designs with clear understanding of the Director’s vision: both stylized sketches and technical flats.
● Partner with team in the development of print and embroideries across all collections - driving newness and fresh perspectives.
● Proactively research seasonal trim ideas, new techniques and fabrications, and collaborate with Product Development team for season execution.
● Collaborate with all cross-functional teams in ensuring products are executed with the intended vision through and through, and on time.
● Participate in seasonal fittings, merchandising meetings, photoshoots and presentations.

TECHNICAL:
● Product Lifecycle Management: Manage product lifecycle from sketch through showroom sample completion.
● Collaborate with Design and Production creating cost effective styles
● Technical Specification: Generate computerized technical specification packages; Review and evaluate samples for spec, pattern, shape, and construction.
● Systems: Use PLM, File Maker (we will teach) and photoshop.
● Communication: Communicate with overseas offices and vendors to identify and resolve issues with garment construction.

Position is Full-time in NYC Midtown office

Salary: $60k - $70k plus benefits

If interested, please send resume and cover letter to HR@reemacra.com
